intro: Picris nepalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Picris nepalensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
